content: for AI.  WebSphere Application Server V5R1 and later, and products that are based on it, such as WebSphere Portal, WebSphere Enterprise Service Bus (WebSphere ESB), and WebSphere Business Integration (WBI) for z/OS.  CICS/TS V2R3 and later.  Db2 UDB for z/OS Version 8 and later.  IMS Version 8 and later.  zIIP Assisted HiperSockets for large messages.  z/OSMF (z/OS Management Facility).  IBM z/OS Platform for Apache Spark.  IBM Watson® Machine Learning for z/OS.  z/OS System Recovery Boost.  Approved third-party vendor products. The use of a zIIP is transparent to application programs. The supported operating systems are listed in Table 7-3 on page 253. On IBM z16 servers, the zIIP processor is designed to run in SMT mode, with up to two threads per processor. This function is designed to help improve throughput for zIIP workloads and provide appropriate performance measurement, capacity planning, and SMF accounting data. zIIP support is available on all currently supported
